frameDefinitions: An Employee voluntarily leaves the service of an Employer.

An Agent has attempted to achieve a Goal, and the actual outcome of the Agent's action has been resolved, so that it either specifically matches the Agent's intent (e.g. success) or does not match it (e.g. failure).
Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other.
A Capitulator who has been opposing a Force, which is typically exerted by a Compeller, ceases opposing that Force.
A Person has a particular mental state and the ability to engage in an activity with enthusiasm, energy, and positivity.
An Event with multiple Participants takes place.
frameExamples: Leah <t>quit</t> her job after one month because of an evil force.
He <t>pulled</t> <t>off</t> his April Fool's Day prank by the barest of margins .

A mulberry is very <t>similar</t> in shape
to a loganberry
Accordingly, there is no basis to conclude that Tazewell <t>acquiesced</t> in the rule against claim-splitting.
MATAC looks forward to your <t>participation</t> in helping promote telework in the Mid-Atlantic region.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who is obligated to perform some task in order to receive compensation.
The person (or institution) in whose employ  the <fen>Employee</fen> stood.
The Field that one works in.
The label given to a particular type of service that the employer quits.
This role identifies the Time when an <fen>Employee</fen> quits the employment of the <fen>Employer</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Employee</fen> quits the employment of the <fen>Employer</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
A participant function in a particular event or in events of a particular kind.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt succeeds or fails.
The place where an attempt succeeds or fails.
This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose similarity is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the entity characterized by its similarity to <fen>Entity_2</fen>, whose characteristics are assumed to be known.  <fen>Entity_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Entities</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Entity_2</fen> is the one whose characteristics are assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing characteristics of <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the entities is assessed.
A fact about <fen>Entity_1</fen> or the <fen>Entities</fen> that reveals how <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the same or different from other entities.  (Note the contrast with 'as to'.)
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the similarity occurs or exists.
The Place is the general area in which similarity occurs or exists
The individual that yields to the <fen>Force</fen> exerted by the <fen>Compeller</fen>.
The matter, usually concerning a course of action, in which the <fen>Capitulator</fen> has disagreed with the <fen>Compeller</fen>.
An individual that intentionally exerts <fen>Force</fen> on the <fen>Capitulator</fen>.

A state of affairs, typically brought about by a <fen>Compeller</fen>, that impinges on the <fen>Capitulator</fen> and eventually causes them to no longer pursue their own view on the <fen>Issue</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Capitulator</fen> engages in after giving in to the <fen>Force</fen>.
The time period during which the <fen>Capitulator</fen> yields to the <fen>Compeller</fen> on the <fen>Issue</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Capitulator</fen> ceases to oppose the <fen>Force</fen>.
The person who is evaluated for a level of enthusiasm.
The individuals or entities that have been participants in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<fen>Participant_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
A grammatically less prominent participant of an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
An <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>, who may or may not be involved intentionally.
A group, location, or institution conventionally associated with an <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the multiple-participant <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
The location where the <fen>Event</fen> involving multiple <fen>Participants</fen> occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> just quit yesterday!
He replaces Michael Lawrie, 50, who quit <fex>IBM</fex> to run Siebel.
He might quit <fex>showbusiness</fex> for years.
I  quit <fex>as a professional player</fex>!
Guess who just quit <fex>today</fex>!
Actually Iquit <fex>in the lobby</fex> before I got to my office.
<fex>John</fex> managed a feeble smile.
If you don't succeed <fex>in your subterfuge</fex>, then report back for further orders.
Benedikt was successful <fex>as a master brewer of beer</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he succeeded in putting the wig on the corpse.
<fex>The two painters</fex> were alike in being unable to draw acceptably .
In the first phase <fex>Barthes's approach</fex> has similarities to that of Levi-Strauss.
The results of Method 2 show remarkable similarity <fex>to those obtained by Method 1</fex>
The disc announced Friday is <fex>physically</fex> similar to current music CDs
His presidency was different <fex>in that it offered a way forward for the common man</fex> .
I sensed that if <fex>John</fex> caved in to her that it would hurt his game.
Historically, the Senate has yielded to the House <fex>on the issue</fex>.
Relatively new to business, poor Kellie had eventually caved in <fex>to him</fex>.

In 1649, Descartes yielded <fex>to the request of Queen Christina of Sweden that he
join her distinguished circle she was assembling in Stockholm</fex>.
After months of pressure by my staff, I have finally yielded <fex>to doing a commentary on advertising</fex>.
Ms Marinkovic relented <fex>yesterday</fex> under intense international pressure.
John refused to heed the barons? early calls for reform, but in June 1215 he capitulated <fex>at Runnymede</fex>.
Thereafter, <fex>everybody</fex> participated in the 17 May parade ending in the Nordic Club.
Last year, <fex>Bill</fex> participated in the Montana State University Earth Systems Science distance learning course in the Atmosphere Unit.

The Second Amended Complaint alleges that Andrew S. Pitt ('Pitt'), Conectisys Corporation ('Conectisys' or the 'Company'), and BM
Capital Corp. participated <fex>with Zaman and Smith Benton</fex> in a fraudulent and manipulative trading scheme.
Some who participated <fex>in D-Day</fex> are finally ready to talk about it
Several of the countries were unable to participate <fex>in the market</fex> .

A survey of students who participated <fex>last year</fex> showed that 61 percent would be the
first in their family to attend college.
The most exciting tours for Mr. Osako were when he participated <fex>in France, Belgium, Holland, Cuba and Japan</fex>.

The Archaeology of the Holy Land from the Destruction of Solomon's Temple to the Muslim Conquest and Stone and Dung, Oil and Spit: Jewish Daily Life in the Time of Jesus
